description: From Latin potestativus, from potestas (“power”). Compare French potestatif. See potent.

adjectives.description: potestative (comparative more potestative, superlative most potestative)

examples: The third branch of God's authoritative or potestative power consisteth in the use of all things in his possession, by virtue of his absolute dominion.

entries.meaning: (law) of a condition in a legal contract: being completely controlled by exactly one of the parties to the contract
examples: A potestative condition is that which is in the power of the person in whose favor it is contracted; as, if I engage to give my neighbor a sum of money, in case he cuts down a tree which obstructs my prospect.
